contentrichtext.text: {{For|the mayor of Rochdale|Zulfiqar Ali (mayor)}} {{BLP sources|date=February 2010}} {{Infobox cricketer | name = Zulfiqar Ali | image = Cricket_no_pic.png | country = East Africa | batting = Right-handed batsman | bowling = Right-arm medium | deliveries = overs | columns = 2 | column1 = [[Test cricket|Tests]] | matches1 = - | runs1 = - | bat avg1 = - | 100s/50s1 = -/- | top score1 = - | deliveries1 = - | wickets1 = - | bowl avg1 = - | fivefor1 = - | tenfor1 = - | best bowling1 = - | catches/stumpings1 = -/- | column2 = [[One Day International|ODIs]] | matches2 = 3 | runs2 = 39 | bat avg2 = 19.50 | 100s/50s2 = 0/0 | top score2 = 30 | deliveries2 = 35 | wickets2 = 4 | bowl avg2 = 41.50 | fivefor2 = - | tenfor2 = n/a | best bowling2 = 3/63 | catches/stumpings2 = 1/0 | date = 31 March | year = 2006 | source = http://content.cricinfo.com/southafrica/content/player/23977.html }} '''Zulfiqar Ali''' (born 1947, [[Mombasa]], [[Kenya]]) was a right-handed [[cricket]] [[Bowler (cricket)|bowler]] who played three [[One Day International|ODIs]] for [[East Africa cricket team|East Africa]]. In his third match, against [[England cricket team|England]], he took three [[wicket]]s for 63 runs, the best figures by any East African bowler. {{East Africa Squad 1975 Cricket World Cup}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Ali, Zulfiqar | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Cricketer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1947 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ali, Zulfiqar}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:East African cricketers]] [[Category:East Africa One Day International cricketers]] [[Category:Cricketers at the 1975 Cricket World Cup]] [[Category:Kenyan cricketers]] {{Kenya-cricket-bio-stub}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}}
